item.title: Ex Governor of Oyo State may announce 2015 ambition soon.
item.description: An ex- Governor of Oyo State, Chief Adebayo Alao-Akala, stated that he would soon decide on his 2015 ambition. He declared this while briefing the newsmen in his hometown of Ogbomosho on January 17, 2014, Friday. Speaking about the posters announcing his political ambition, he said they emanated from his followers, who still have confidence in his leadership. Chief Adebayo Alao-Akala further noted that the Peoples’ Democratic Party in Oyo State was united, adding that individual interest could override that of the party.

item.title: Fayemi Opens Up On What He Knows About Jonathan As APC Member, Consensus Candidate
item.description: Ekiti State Governor and 2023 presidential aspirant, Kayode Fayemi has declared he is not aware that former President Goodluck Jonathan is a member of the All Progressives Congress (APC). The Governor submitted that the official status of former President Goodluck Jonathan in APC is unknown to him. Naija News reports Gov. Fayemi made the submission during an interview with Arise TV which was released on Thursday amidst the speculations surrounding the rumoured plans by Jonathan to defect to APC and contest the 2023 presidency on the platform of the ruling party.

item.title: Arsenal Sends Farewell Message To Lacazette As He Leaves The Club
item.description: English Premier League club, Arsenal has confirmed that French striker, Alexandre Lacazette will not be extending his stay with the North London side. Arsenal in a statement on Friday confirmed that Lacazette will leave in a matter of days when his current contract expires on June 30, 2022. Naija News reports the striker joined Arsenal from Lyon in July 2017, and has since made 206 appearances in all competitions for the Gunners, scoring 71 goals in the process.

item.title: Diana Rigg - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Film, TV, and stage actress well known for her role as Emma Peel in The Avengers. She also played Countess Teresa di Vicenzo in the James Bond film On Her Majesty's Secret Service. Trivia She appeared as Lady Holiday in 1981's The Great Muppet Caper.

item.title: Buhari Meets AfDB President Adesina In Aso Rock [Photos]
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Tuesday met with the president of the African Development Bank (AfDB), Akinwumi Adesina. Naija News reports that President Buhari met with Dr Adesina behind closed doors inside the Presidential Villa, Abuja. The details of the meeting have not been released as of the time of filing this report. The former Minister of Agriculture was first elected as AfDB president on May 28, 2015, and currently serving a second term in office.

item.title: FG Reviews COVID-19 Protocol For International Travel
item.description: Following the discovery of the Omicron COVID-19 variant in Nigeria, the Federal Government has reviewed its international travel protocol. Naija News reports that the revised travel protocol was issued by the Presidential Steering Committee on COVID-19 and signed by its chairman, Boss Mustapha. In a statement on Friday, Mustapha stated that the travel protocol which takes effect on December 5, is based on science, national experience, and global developments. The PSC chairman stated that outbound travellers are required to provide either valid evidence of full vaccination against COVID-19 or negative PCR test results within 48hrs from the time of boarding.

item.title: 2023 AFCON Semi-finals Fixtures, Kick-Off Time As South Africa Knockout Cape Verde
item.description: It is going to be the Super Eagles of Nigeria vs Bafana Bafana of South Africa in one of the two semi-finals at the 2023 AFCON in Ivory Coast. South Africa battled with a resilient Cape Verdean side for 120 minutes in the quarter-finals of the 2023 AFCON without conceding nor scoring a goal as the game was forced into a penalty shootout. Before then, both teams had a series of goalscoring opportunities but Cape Verde’s goalkeeper Vozinha and South Africa’s Ronwen Williams kept their respective teams in the game with fantastic saves.

item.title: Adamu Garba Receives Knocks Over Call To Rename University Of Nigeria To 'Queen Elizabeth University
item.description: Former presidential aspirant, Adamu Garba, has received knocks online after revealing how Queen Elizabeth II should be immortalized in Nigeria. Naija News earlier reported that the Queen died on Thursday evening, a few hours after doctors raised concern over her health. Since her demise, many Nigerians and the world at large have continued to pay tribute to the 96-year-old monarch. In a post shared on the microblogging platform, Twitter, Adamu said the first Nigerian University in Nsukka should be renamed in honour of Queen Elizabeth.

item.title: Five New CBN Policy That Affects Nigerians
item.description: The Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) on Tuesday introduced new policy that directs banks to only load N200 notes and lower denominations into their Automated Teller Machines. According to the memo issued to banks on Tuesday and signed by the CBN Director of Banking Supervision, Haruna .B. Mustafa, the Apex bank restricted withdrawals from point of sale terminal to N20,000 on a daily basis. It also pegged weekly withdrawal from banks (over the counter) at N100,000 and N500,000 weekly for individuals and corporate organisations respectively.

item.title: Mmesoma: Go Ahead And Cast The First Stone
item.description: Former Kaduna Central lawmaker, Shehu Sani has reacted to the controversy surrounding the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) result of Ejikeme Joy Mmesoma. Naija News recalls that on Sunday, the Joint Admission and Matriculation Board (JAMB) accused Ejikeme of allegedly manipulating her results and inflating the scores from 249 to 362. However, the teenager in a video, on Monday, insisted that the 362 was the score she received on the JAMB website and in the SMS sent to her by the board.

item.title: Oshiomhole Warns Against Reducing Governance To Gender, Age
item.description: A former Governor of Edo State, Adams Oshiomhole, has stated that it is dangerous to reduce governance in the country to gender and age. The Former National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress gave this warning while speaking at the public presentation of a book titled, ‘Politics that works’, written by Babafemi Ojudu and Alex James. Oshiomhole noted that he has met with elder people who have good hearts towards the betterment of the country and the same goes for the younger generation.

item.title: Aqua - Members, Ages, Trivia
item.description: Bubblegum pop group best known for their multi-platinum crossover single "Barbie Girl." They released albums by the titles of Aquarium in 1997, Aquarius in 2000 and Megalomania in 2011. They broke up in 2001, reunited from 2008 to 2012, and reunited again in 2016. Their long list of accolades included Danish Music Award, World Music Award, IFPI Platinum Europe Award, and MTV Europe Music Award wins, among others.

item.description: The monarch had congratulated Adeleke asking people to cooperate with him. Recall that the monarch had earlier promised the All Progressive Congress 90,000 votes before the election “I am confident of delivering 90,000 votes for Governor Oyetola.” he said. However, the election was far below the Oba’s expectations as the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) lost to the opposition PDP. item.title: Fulani Group Establishes Football Association
item.description: Kautal Hore, a Fulani socio-cultural group has in a bid to encourage its younger tribesmen in engaging in social activities, especially sports, established a football association. Naija News reports that the Jigawa State chapter Chairman of the association, Alhaji Umar Dubantu, disclosed this during interaction with news reporters in Dutse, the state capital on Monday. Dubantu told journalists that the group will roll out talent discovery events for nomadic children across the state.

item.title: Besouda gets powers to combat ICC witness tampering
item.description: - International Criminal Court judges have amended rule 165 of the Rules of Procedure and Evidence to allow the prosecutor to initiate investigations into offences against administration of justice like witness tampering - ICC Chief Prosecutor Fatou Bensouda has been complaining of witness tempering in the Kenyan cases at the Hague International Criminal Court (ICC) judges have given the court prosecutor powers to initiate investigations on witness tampering. The judges, in a statement issued on Tuesday, March 1, said the changes are aimed at enhancing overall efficiency of proceedings before the court.

item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) is reportedly set to officially begin campaign for its presidential candidate, Bola Tinubu, in another state rather than Kwara. Naija News recalls that Tinubu alongside the Progressive Governors Forum, Presidential Campaign Council and members of the APC National Working Committee, chose Kwara State as the first place to launch the campaign. The APC stakeholders agreed to launch Tinubu’s campaign in Ilorin, the Kwara state capital at a tripartite meeting held recently at the Transcorp Hotel in Abuja.

item.title: Good Samaritans Offer to Help Man Accused of Stealing Diapers, Wipes from Store

According to police officers in Florida, the US, the man and his kids purchased diapers and baby wipes at the supermarket, but his card was declined on reaching the checkout counter.

The actress made this known in a post shared on her Instagram page, alleging domestic violence issues in her marriage. The mother of four said many have died pretending all is well while wishing, hoping, and praying for a better tomorrow. Chacha said she doesn’t want to die or go inexplicably missing. She apologized to the public for living a lie for the past years as there has been trouble in her perceived paradise.

item.title: Presidential Tribunal: They Are Not Ready To Defend This Case
item.description: The legal team of the 2023 Labour Party (LP) presidential candidate, Peter Obi has slammed the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) over its inability to present witnesses before the Presidential Election Petition Tribunal on Monday. item.title: Players Can Now Refund 'Fortnite' Skins for Unwanted Items Here's How

item.title: We Are Preparing To Announce New Minimum Wage
item.description: The Federal Government has said there are preparations by President Bola Tinubu to announce a new minimum wage for civil servants. The Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF), George Akume, made this known in Abuja on Thursday while flagging off a new presidential initiative for women’s empowerment. Akume, who represented President Tinubu at the event, said things would begin to change as more Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) buses make their way to the country.

item.title: Why I Dumped PDP For APC
item.description: Governor Ben Ayade of Cross River State has explained that his defection from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) to the All Progressives Congress (APC). Speaking during his appearance on Channels Television’s Politics Today on Thursday, Ayade said he joined APC to help President Muhammadu Buhari in dealing with the challenges facing the country. He added that he defected to the APC because of the leadership qualities of the President, adding that he had no issue with the PDP.

item.title: "Who Is Fooling Who?" Edwin Clark Writes Open Letter To President Buhari (Full Text)
item.description: Elder statesman, Chief Edwin Clark has written an open letter to President Muhammadu Buhari, challenging the plans by his government to establish a naval base in Kano State. Clark in his personally signed letter argued that the project is a misplaced priority as the funds could have been channeled to more viable efforts. He added that though he has written many letters to the President, some close, others open, Buhari and his government has never deemed it fit to acknowledge, treat or act on the contents but for the sake of posterity, he would continue to make his mind known on issues that need him to speak up.

item.title: Baraje Reveals PDP NEC Agreement Affecting Party Chairman, Ayu
item.description: Former National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Abubakar Baraje has revealed why there is much call for the party’s National Chairman, Iyorchia Ayu to resign. According to Baraje, the main opposition party has a tradition of zoning its party offices. He further stated that the office of the National Chairman is expected to be zoned to the South if the presidential candidate comes from the North. Baraje recalled a scenario that saw a former national chairman of the party in 2018, Ahmadu Ali go after the elections had been conducted and won.

item.title: EPL: Chelsea's Tuchel, Liverpool's Klopp Currently Not Happy
item.description: Leicester City manager, Brendan Rodgers has asserted that Chelsea manager, Thomas Tuchel and his Liverpool counterpart, Jurgen Klopp are currently not happy with their position in the Premier League table. Speaking after Leicester City’s Premier League 2-0 defeat to Liverpool on Thursday at his post-match press conference, Rodgers said only Manchester City boss, Pep Guardiola could boast that he is happy at the moment. According to him, the Spanish professional football coach will be happy because his team currently tops the league table.

item.title: NCCs Outreach Programme, Campus Conversation, Debuts in Abuja
item.description: Following the re-structuring and re-branding of its existing consumer outreach programmes, the Nigerian Communications Commission (NCC) has held the maiden edition of the Campus Conversation at the University of Abuja. Campus Conversation is featured as an important part of NCC’s new Telecom Consumer Conversation (TCC). Speaking at the event, which held at the Main Campus of the University of Abuja at the weekend, NCC’s Director, Consumer Affairs Bureau, Efosa Idehen, said the Commission, as a consumer-centric regulator, has always been at the forefront of protecting the interest of the consumers.

item.title: President Jonathan Orders Release Of 165 Boko Haram Suspects
item.description: President Goodluck Jonathan has ordered the release of a fresh batch of over 165 persons apprehended by security agencies in connection with the attack on Boko Haram terrorism in the North East States of Borno, Adamawa and Yobe States. A statement signed by Major General Chris Olukolade, Director of Defence Information said, “Over 165 persons apprehended in the course of military operations on terror in three states in the North-East are to be released from custody in compliance with Presidential directive”.

item.title: Report Shows Drop In Foreign Investments For Nigeria's Manufacturing Sector
item.description: Foreign investments into Nigeria’s manufacturing industry saw a significant decrease of 35% from $392.5 million in the last quarter of 2022 to $256 million in the initial quarter of 2022, as per the 2023 Q1 capital importation report by the National Bureau of Statistics. The report also highlighted a general decline in capital importation into Nigeria in Q1 2023, standing at $1.1 billion, a decrease of 28% from the $1.5 billion recorded in Q1 2022.

item.title: 'APC Will Rule Nigeria For Sixty Years'
item.description: The former Speaker of Kaduna State House of Assembly, Yusuf Ibrahim Zailani expressed confidence on Thursday that under the leadership of the party’s National Chairman, Dr. Abdullahi Ganduje, the All Progressives Congress (APC) has the potential to govern for more than six decades. This bold prediction recalls a similar statement made about 15 years ago by Vincent Ogbulafor, the then-national Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Ogbulafor had asserted that the PDP would dominate for at least 60 years due to its commendable policies.

item.title: 2023: I Have Been Intimidated By A Government I Formed
item.description: The lawmaker representing Imo West Senatorial district, Rochas Okorocha has revealed how he has suffered injustice in the hands of the government he helped to form. The former Governor of Imo State wondered why the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) filed a corruption case on the day he officially declared his ambition to run in the 2023 presidential election. According to Okorocha, the intimidation by the commission is to make sure that he does not run on the platform of the All Progressives Congress.

item.title: Ex-Lawmaker, Nwuke Backs Ortom Over Comment On Wike
item.description: A former member of the House of Representatives, Ogbonna Nwuke, has commended Governor Samuel Ortom for comment on his Rivers counterpart, Nyesom Wike. Recall that Ortom had in an interview on Arise News on Wednesday decried the alleged poor treatment meted out to Wike by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Presidential candidate, Atiku Abubakar. The Benue governor also accused Atiku of failing to honour the democratic choice in the selection of his running mate for the 2023 presidential election.

item.title: 'Believe Celebrities At You Own Risk'
item.description: Former Big Brother Naija ‘Shine Ya Eye’ Housemate, Christy O, has reacted to the unveiling of ‘All-Stars’ Housemates. Naija News reports that selected housemates from previous editions of the show, like Mercy, WhiteMoney, Venita, Neo, Ike, Cee-C, Cross, Angel and Alex, Seyi, Kiddwaya, among others, returned to the reality TV show on Sunday. Reacting to this, Christy O, in a post via her Twitter page, expressed surprise at how some ex-housemates who had vowed never to return to Big Brother made it to the ‘All-Stars’ edition.

item.title: Alex Pereira Insists On Fighting Israel Adesanya Again
item.description: Brazilian mixed martial artist, Alex Pereira, has insisted that he has unfinished business with Nigerian-Austrialian MMA star Israel Adesanya. Last weekend, Alex Pereira made his light heavyweight debut at UFC 291 against Polish MMA star Jan Błachowicz. After winning the fight via split decision, the Brazilian fighter had to remind the world of his beef with the Nigerian fighter. After facing Israel Adesanya twice in the past, the Brazilian fighter insisted that he is open to fighting him for the third time.

item.title: Details Of Meeting Between Tinubu And Benin Republic President Emerge
item.description: The details of the meeting between President Bola Tinubu, and his Benin Republic counterpart, Patrice Talon, have emerged. Naija News reports that both African leaders met on the sidelines of the Paris Global Financial Pact Summit in Paris, France on Friday. In a statement released by his spokesman, Dele Alake, the President said his administration is ready to improve Nigeria’s relationship with other African countries. The Nigerian president told his Beninoise counterpart that his administration is open and accessible to all neighbouring countries.

item.description: 'Lost Ollie' is a CGI and live-action-blended tale fit for the whole family. Is the Netflix miniseries based on a book? Have you ever had a favorite teddy bear, one you grew up with, who's seen you at your highest and your lowest moments? Or perhaps it was a dog, or a bunny. At this point, after years of love, Fluffer has a wonky right eye, pilling fur, and a spot near his tail where you spilled hot chocolate on him.

item.title: Jack Guy - Age, Family, Bio
Makinde Opens Up On Why Auxiliary Was Sacked As Oyo State PMS Chairman
item.description: The Oyo State Governor, Seyi Makinde has shed more light on why Alhaji Mukaila Lamidi a.k.a Auxiliary was sacked as the chairman of the Park Management System (PMS) in the state. Speaking on Sunday at the thanksgiving service in commemoration of Omituntun 2.0 administration at St. Peters Cathedral, Aremo, Ibadan, Makinde explained that the need to ensure a peaceful atmosphere and avoid fights in the garages necessitated his action. According to him, no meaningful activity can take place in an atmosphere of insecurity hence the need to sanitize the system.

item.description: The Rivers state government has traced the black soot polluting the atmosphere of Port Harcourt and its environs to a Chinese construction company, named CGC. According to a statement Commissioner of Information, Dr Austin Tam-George, the company has been shutdown by the Rivers State Task Force on the Black Soot. A statement by Tam-George on Saturday, February 11 read: "This is to inform the public that a Chinese construction company, named CGC, located on the Obirikwere-Airport Link Road has been shut down on Friday, the 10th of February, 2017, by the Rivers State Task Force on the Black Soot.

Alexander Forbes Kenya was founded in the year 1994 and has now grown to be the most significant pension administrator in Kenya, with a client base of about 160,000.

item.title: Top APC Chieftain, Inuwa Dumps APC For PDP
item.description: A top chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Katsina State, Mustapha Inuwa has dumped the party for the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP). Inuwa announced his defection at his campaign office in Katsina on Sunday after meeting with his supporters and groups. The supporters after the meeting chanted songs of solidarity on his capacity and ability to shape the politics of the State. The former Secretary to the Katsina State Government (SSG) contested for the governorship ticket of the APC in the state but lost to Dikko Umar Radda.

item.title: Tinubu Condemns Heinous Plateau Killings, Directs Immediate Arrest Of Culprits
item.description: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has strongly condemned the heinous and brutal attacks in Bokkos and Barkin-Ladi Local Government Areas of Plateau State. Naija News reports that over 190 persons were confirmed dead following attacks by gunmen on several communities in Bokkos and Barikin-Ladi Local Government Area of Plateau. It was gathered that the gunmen launched the attacks on the residents of the three LGAs from Saturday till about 10 pm on Christmas Eve.

item.description: After a long wait by his fans, Wande Coal is set to release his sophomore album, Wanted.  D’banj and Wande Coal popularly known as Black Diamond were members of the now defunct Mo’hits records before the label split in 2012 after a rift between D’banj and Don Jazzy. item.title: PDP Spokesman, Olisa Metuh, Resigns
item.description: The National Publicity Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, Olisa Metuh, has formally announced his decision to resign his position. Mr. Metuh announced his resignation at a brief press conference on in Abuja, saying he would throw in the towel on Thursday at the party’s National Executive Committee, NEC, meeting. “I want to inform you that I am resigning as the National Publicity Secretary with effect from Thursday, 20th June 2013,” he said.

item.title: Jose Peseiro Admits Nigeria Suffered Against South Africa As He Gives Update On Zaidu Sanusi
item.description: Super Eagles head coach, Jose Peseiro has stressed that his team suffered during their 2023 AFCON semi-final clash against South Africa on Wednesday, February 7. During the game, Jose Peseiro watched helplessly as Bafana Bafana of South Africa put pressure on the Super Eagles for 45 minutes and had to rely on the confident goalkeeping of Stanley Nwabali. In the second half, South Africa continued to threaten Nigeria’s defense and the Eagles struggled to create chances until after the 65th minute mark.

item.title: FG To Deploy 5G Network By January 2022
item.description: The Nigerian Government has announced plans to deploy the fifth-generation (5G) technology in the country in January 2022. The Minister of Communication and Digital Economy, Isa Pantami, disclosed this on Thursday at a town hall meeting in Maiduguri, Borno State. Represented by the NCC Commissioner for Technical Services, Ubale Maska, the minister stated that the 5G network would address the vandalism of power and telecommunications infrastructure in the country. Maska explained that the technology would help track vandals destroying public assets across the country, adding the criminals would be arrested and prosecuted.

item.title: Ho Chi Minh - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Communist revolutionary who led the Việt Minh independence movement, which established the communist-ruled Democratic Republic of Vietnam in 1945. He served as prime minister from 1945 to 1955 and as the president of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam from 1945 to 1969. Before Fame He worked as a cook's helper on a ship before sailing to the United States in 1912. Trivia South Vietnam's capital, formerly called Saigon, is named after him.

item.title: Strike: FG Has Paid ASUU 92b
item.description: The Minister of Labour and Employment, Chris Ngige, on Tuesday, claimed that the Federal Government has so far paid the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) over ₦92 billion as earned allowances and revitalisation fees to federal-owned universities across the country. Ngige stated this while giving an update on the ongoing negotiation between FG and ASUU. Recall that ASUU on February 14 embarked on a one-month warning strike to press home their demands.

item.title: FG Declares June 12 Public Holiday
item.description: The Federal Government of Nigeria has declared Monday, June 12, 2023, a public holiday to mark this year’s Democracy Day. Naija News gathered that the announcement was stated in a statement released in Abuja on Thursday. The Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Interior, Dr Oluwatoyin Akinlade, conveyed the government’s congratulations to all Nigerians on this occasion. She recognized that Nigeria’s journey to democracy, like many other nations, has experienced both trials and triumphs.

item.title: Industrial Court To Deliver Decision On Sanus's Suit On June 13
item.description: Justice Babatunde Adejumo, the President of the Industrial Court, will on 13 June announce weather the court will hear the case filed by Sanusi Lamido Sanusi challenging his suspension from the position of the governor of the Central Bank. On May 20 Justice Gabriel Kolawole of an Abuja Federal High Court dismissed the suit filed by Sanusi against President Goodluck Jonathan over his suspension saying the court did not have jurisdiction to entertain the suit.

item.title: Parts Of Lagos State To Be Cut Off From Electricity For 8 Weeks As Ikeja Electric Announces Upgrade
item.description: Residents of some areas in Lagos State will be without normal power supply for eight weeks, the Ikeja Electricity Company has announced. This is to allow the electricity distribution company carry out an upgrade to the 132KVA conductors from Ogba to Ikeja which will be undertaken by the Transmission Company of Nigeria (TCN). The power outage will begin from October 11 and will be within the hours of 8am to 6 pm daily, Naija News understands.

item.title: Insecurity: Declare State Of Emergency In The North Before We Perish
item.description: Zamfara State Governor, Bello Matawalle has lamented that the current wave of insecurity can sink the North if urgent solutions are not deployed. To this end, the Governor has called for a state of emergency to be declared in the north by the federal government. Matawalle made the call on Wednesday when he received the Assistant Inspector General of Police in charge of zone 10, Ali Janga at the Zamfara Government House, Gusau.

item.title: House of reps do not accept Sanusi's suspension.
item.description: The House of Representatives rejected President Goodluck Jonathan's suspension of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) Governor, Sanusi Lamido Sanusi, on February 20, 2014, Thursday. The House took the decision after adopting a motion on the matter moved by minority whip, Samson Osagie. Osagie argued that Sanusi's suspension was unconstitutional and antithetical to Nigeria's economy coming at the time the CBN Governor raised some concerns about missing funds. He said the timing was wrong and Sanusi should not be washed away, as he was only carrying out his duties as the Chief Executive Officer of the Apex Bank.

item.title: Presidential Committee To Investigate Breach Of Explosive Control Law
item.description: President Bola Tinubu has directed the establishment of a presidential committee to probe potential violations of explosive control laws in the country, prompted by the recent explosions in Ibadan, the capital of Oyo State. The Tuesday night explosion in the Bodija area resulted in the tragic loss of two lives, injuries to approximately 80 individuals, and extensive damage to numerous buildings, vehicles, and other properties. Responding to inquiries from State House correspondents after the Federal Executive Council meeting overseen by President Tinubu at the Presidential Villa in Abuja, the Minister of Defence, Abubakar Badaru, disclosed that the council has mandated an immediate investigation to uncover the precise cause of the unfortunate explosion.

item.description: The 2023-2024 Premier League match week two will kick off on Friday, August 18, with Nottingham Forest vs Sheffield United clash at City Ground from 7:45 p.m. Newly promoted side Luton Town won’t be able to host fellow newly promoted side and reigning EFL Championship winners, Burnley at the Kenilworth Road due to the ongoing renovation at the stadium. item.description: Two days after his inauguration, President Bola Tinubu has reportedly appointed the Speaker of the House of Representatives, Femi Gbajabiamila as his Chief of Staff. item.title: Fire Guts Federal Secretariat Abuja
item.description: The Federal Secretariat located at the Three Arms Zone in Abuja was on Wednesday gutted by fire. item.title: Haaland, Mbappe Will Replicate Messi-Ronaldo Era
item.description: Former Arsenal and Ivory Coast defender, Kolo Toure believes Erling Haaland and Kylian Mbappe can replicate the competition between Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. item.title: PDP Speaks On Wike Dumping Party
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has reacted to speculations that the Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike, may dump the party amidst the crisis rocking the party. The National Publicity Secretary, Debo Ologunagba, in a statement released on Friday, dismissed the claim that Wike would dump PDP. Ologunagba described the Rivers State Governor as an important and loyal member of the party. He further stated that Governor Wike has invested so much in the main opposition party for him to dump the party.

item.title: Top Nigerian Newspapers Headlines For Today, Tuesday, 10th August, 2021
item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspapers headlines in Nigeria for today, Tuesday, 10th August 2021 There were strong indications, on Monday, that some aggrieved members of the All Progressives Congress, APC, had perfected plans to storm the party’s national secretariat to cause a breach of public peace over the continued leadership of Governor Mai Mala Buni-led Caretaker Committee. This group, Naija News learnt from impeccable sources in the APC, had vowed that the Buni Committee would be fought hard on all fronts, including attacks on staff members of the Secretariat until they stepped down.

Jonathan's Former Chief of Army Staff Ihejirika Joins APC
item.description: Former Chief of Army Staff Lieutenant-General Azubuike Ihejirika has officially joined the All Progressives Congress (APC). Naija News reports that Ihejirika, who was the Chief of Army Staff between 2010 – 2014 under former President Goodluck Jonathan, joined the APC at Isuikwuato country home in Abia-North Senatorial District. Ihejirika’s registration was conducted by the APC ward Chairman Mr. Iheanyi Chukwu in the presence of stalwarts of the party which include: Senator Orji Uzor Kalu, State Secretary of the party, Barr.

item.title: Obiano Leaves As Soludo Is Sworn-in As New Anambra Governor
item.description: Former Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) Governor, Chukwuma Soludo, has been sworn in as the new governor of Anambra State. Naija News reports that Soludo had taken his oath of office in the company of his wife, Mrs Nonye, alongside his Deputy, Dr Onyeka Ibezim and his wife. Soludo was sworn in by the Chief Judge of Anambra State, Hon. Justice Onochie M. Anyachebelu. It was gathered that the former Anambra State, Chief Willie Obiano, has left the venue of the swearing-in ceremony.

item.title: Ebola: Jim Iyke Flees Liberia Earlier Than Scheduled
item.description: Nigerian actor Jim Iyke took yesterday to his Instagram page to say he is leaving Liberia earlier than scheduled over Ebola scare. So-called Nollywood bad boy, who has been recently in the news in connection with the break-up with his girlfriend Nadia Buari, posted the photo of himself masked with the caption: "Monrovia, unfinished biz; Leavin tonite. Nt ashamed to admit tis ish scares the Jesus outta me. #Ebola!!!!" There is definitely nothing to be ashamed of as the deadly virus outbreak has already claimed lives of 672 people in Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone since February, according to WHO.

Police IG Confirms Those Who Attacked Imo Police Station, Prison
item.description: The Inspector-General of Police, Mohammed Adamu on Monday declared that members of the Eastern Security Network (ESN) carried out the attack in Imo State. He said in a statement on Monday that ESN, which is the security arm of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) was responsible for the attack on the Imo State Police Command headquarters and the Owerri Correctional Prison. The Police boss’s statement comes after IPOB had initially denied media reports that it was responsible for the attack on Imo Police Headquarters and Correctional Centre.

item.description: Good morning Nigeria, welcome to Naija News roundup of top newspaper headlines in Nigeria for today Saturday, 20th August 2022. Before now, mum had been the word from the Minister of Education, as students of public universities vegetate at home with their future being blatantly taken from them.

item.title: Bayelsa: Female Corps Member Attacked By Cultists, Has Hand Severed
item.description: Miss Folakemi Akinbode, a female corps member of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) was assaulted on Monday night and had her right hand chopped off. Miss Akinbode, 26, hails from Ondo State, and is a Batch A Corps member serving in the Obuah community in Yenagoa local government area of Bayelsa State. The young woman is the alumna of Nursing from the Madonna University, Elele in Rivers State. The horrendous incident took place on Monday at around 8.

item.title: Buhari Speaks On Obiozor's Election As Ohanaeze President
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has felicitated with George Obiozor on his election as the new President-general of Ohanaeze Ndigbo. Naija News reports that Obiozor emerged victorious after defeating Chief Valentine Oparaocha and Chief Uju Savior Okoro in the election held on Sunday in Owerri, the Imo state capital. Obiozor was a former Ambassador to the United States from 2004 to 2008 and former ambassador to Israel and Cyprus. According to a statement on Monday by the Presidential Spokesman, Garba Shehu, the Nigerian leader asked Obiozor to deploy his wealth of experience within and outside government to forge greater unity of the country.

item.title: President Buhari To Visit Turkey, Ebonyi, Kano, Daura
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari is reportedly set to depart the country for Turkey on December 15, 2021. It was gathered that the president would also visit Ebonyi, Kano as well as to his hometown of Daura in Katsina State to likely spend the New Year break. “Buhari to visit Turkey; the programme is for December 15. Local trips in December include Ebonyi, Kano and Daura where he will likely spend the New Year break,” a source within the President’s circle told SaharaReporters on Saturday.

item.title: NDLEA Seeks School Principals Support To Curb Drug Abuse In Niger State

Naija News reports that the state’s NDLEA commander, Musa Bwalin, made the call on Monday in Minna during a drug misuse sensitization session for secondary school principals. The program’s objective, according to Bwalin, was to make principals more aware of drug abuse and the risks associated with it.

item.title: 'Popular Nollywood Actress Battling Brain Disease'
item.description: Popular Yoruba Nollywood actress, Bisola Badmus, has opened up on her battle with a brain disease called, Encephalopathy. Naija News reports that the movie star spoke about the ailment in a post via her Instagram page on Tuesday while celebrating her birthday. Explainer: Encephalopathy is a disease that alters the mental state, leaving one confused and not acting like they usually do. According to Bisola, she had been battling the disease for over one year and also lost her mother.

item.description: -Mwanapatholojia Mkuu wa serikali Johansen Oduor alisema kemikali yenye sumu katika moshi huo ulipunguza hewa ya oksijeni katika mwili wa Korir - Chembe za moshi zilipatikana ndani ya mapafu ya marehemu Korir, maana kuwa alisalia hai dakika chache baada ya moto huo kuzima - Korir, 36, ambaye alifariki dunia katika kisa cha gari lake kuteketea mtaani Buruburu, Nairobi mnamo Aprili 29 Upasuaji uliofanyiwa mwili wa Terance Korir, 36, ambaye alifariki dunia katika kisa cha gari lake kuteketea mtaani Buruburu, Nairobi mnamo Aprili 29, umefichua kuwa aliangamia kutokana na kuvuta moshi wala sio majeraha.

item.title: Meet Nigerian Man Who Makes Michelle Obama's Dresses
item.description: Nigerians are no doubt very creative and artistic, with skills that become recognized all over the world. Such is the peculiar case of Nigerian-born fashion designer Duro Olowu, who was enlisted by the First lady of the United States of America, Michelle Obama, to decorate the White House in preparation for the 2015 Christmas celebrations. According to Ventures Africa, Olowu, along with other fashion designers such as Caroline Herrera, Humberto Leon, Carol Lim and Kenzo, was brought into the White House’s China Room, Vermeil Room, and library for the holiday season.

The official rate today, Tuesday, February 22nd, 2022, for $1 dollar to naira = ₦415.76/$1. According to the data at the FMDQ Security Exchange where forex is traded officially, the exchange rate between the naira and the US dollar opened at ₦415.

item.title: October Horoscope | Famous Birthdays
item.description: The month of October is the tenth month of the Gregorian year, but it is also the first full month of Fall in the year. The early nights and breezy temperatures of October perfectly capture the spirit of autumn. As the month ends, children are given one of their most loved holidays, as they dress as their favorite frightful characters on Halloween. October is also home to numerous other national and international holidays, including Leif Erikson Day, Columbus Day, Canada's Thanksgiving and Freethought Day.

item.title: Toyin Abraham's Ex-lover, Seun Reunites With His Mother
item.description: Nigerian filmmaker, Seun Egbegbe, the ex-lover to Toyin Abraham, on Tuesday, reunited with his mother after six years following his release from prison. Naija News earlier reported that after spending six years and eight months in prison custody, Seun on Wednesday, October 12, 2022, was set free by a Federal High court in Lagos. Egbegbe was remanded on February 10, 2017, after allegedly obtaining money by false pretence from no fewer than 40 Bureaus De Change (BDC) operators in different parts of Lagos over a period of two years between 2015 to 2017.

item.title: Maytree - Members, Ages, Trivia
item.description: Five-member a cappella group from South Korea who took home two gold medals from the 2014 World Choir Games. The previous year they also took first prize at the Yeosu Choral International Competition. Trivia In 2021, they released the original singles "When Snowflakes Fell on Your Head" and "What If." The latter features vocals from Andrea Figallo. Members The group is composed of Jang Sang-in, Kang Soo-kyung, Jeon Sung-hyun, Kim Won-jong, and Lim Soo-yeon.

item.title: What Happened to the old Outdaughtered House?
item.description: What happened to the 'Outdaughtered' house the Busby family lived in before? The Busbys decided not to move back into their formerly mold-infested home. Season 9 of TLC’s hit reality series Outdaughtered premiered on July 11, and the Busbys are enjoying their home, sans mold. Given how much Adam and Danielle raved about the newer residence, we’re not surprised to see that the couple decided to stay put and raise their quintuplets, 5, and oldest daughter Blayke, 9, in the more spacious digs than their previous home.

item.title: Why I Visited IBB - Atiku Shares Details Of Meeting With Former President In Minna
item.description: The details of the meeting between the 2023 presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Atiku Abubakar, and Nigeria’s former Military President, Gen. Ibrahim Badamosi Babangida (rtd) have emerged. As earlier reported by Naija News, Atiku on Friday, visited IBB at his Minna hilltop residence in Minna, Niger State in the company of some top PDP chieftains. Speaking to newsmen after the meeting which was held behind closed doors, Atiku disclosed that he was in the state to pay respect to the former President and to consult with him.

item.title: Agricultural grants in Nigeria 2018: how to get it and use wisely?
item.description: To farm or not to farm is no longer the question. More people are realising that among the various sectors of economic development in Nigeria, agriculture comes out on top as the most profitable. Agriculture has been identified as the largest employer of labor in Africa, particularly Nigeria. A lot of analysts called this sector a gold mine, awaiting to be fully explored. Agricultural loans in NigeriaThe available land for farming activities in Nigeria is simply overwhelming.

Dollar to naira exchange rate today black market (Aboki dollar rate): The exchange rate for a dollar to naira at Lagos Parallel Market (Black Market) players buy a dollar for N940 and sell at N945 on Tuesday, 15th August 2023, according to sources at Bureau De Change (BDC).

item.title: Reactions As Peter Of Psquare Reveals Conversation He Had With His Daughter, Aliona
item.description: Peter of the defunct, Psquare singing group also known as Mr. P has sparked conversations on social media after he shared photos from the conversations he had with his daughter, Aliona. According to Mr. P via his microblogging platform revealed how his young daughter, Aliona called him on a video call to question his love for her mother, who happens to be his wife. He further noted that his daughter gave a bright smile after he replied positively to the question.

item.title: Tunaomba radhi! Jarida la Grazia lamwomba msamaha Lupita kwa picha yake walioichapisha vibaya
item.description: -Jarida la Grazia lilimwangazia mshindi wa tuzo za Oscar Lupita Nyong’o kwenye ukurasa wao wa kwanza -Lupita alikashifu jarida hilo vikali kwa kugeuza nywele yake nzuri kwenye picha hiyo -Grazia imemwomba msahama mwigizaji huyo. Hata hivyo, walimtia lawama mpiga picha wao kwa tukio hilo Jarida la Grazia limemwomba msamaha Lupita Nyong’o baada ya mwigizaji huyo kukashifu vikali jarida hilo. Mwigizaji huyo wa miaka 24 wa filamu ya ‘12-Year-A-Slave’ alikashifu jarida hilo la Marekani kwa kugeuza nywele yake na kumfanya kuwa mweupe kwenye picha waliyotumia kwenye ukurasa wa kwanza wa jarida hilo.

Gunmen 'Kidnap' LP Governorship Candidate
item.description: Unknown gunmen have reportedly abducted Obiora Agbasimelo, the governorship candidate of the Labour Party (LP) in the November 6 Anambra election. Recall that Agbasimelo had emerged as the governorship candidate of the party in a primary election held in the state some months ago. The emergence of Agbasimelo led to a crisis in the party, and one of the leading aspirants in the primaries, Nnamdi Nnoruka, was allegedly kidnapped by unknown persons and forced to withdraw from the contest.

item.title: Buhari Directs Osinbajo, Malami, Others To Declare Their Assets
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has directed Vice President Yemi Osinbajo, and all his cabinet members to declare their assets before the end of his tenure on May 29. The President stated this on Friday when received his Declaration of Assets Form from the Chairman of the Code of Conduct Burea (CCB), Prof. Isah Mohammed, at the State House in Abuja. President Buhari said no one is excluded from the Constitutional duty of assets declaration before and after taking office, hence his strict adherence to the constitutional requirement.

item.description: Model Claps Back At Viral Meme Making Fun Of Her TeethBy Aimee LutkinUpdated Nov. 18 2019, 2:34 p.m. ET Source: TwitterA model named Symone Lu clapped back at a guy who tried to make her into an offensive meme. item.title: Rangnick Replies Ronaldo Over Comment At Interview With Piers Morgan
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo’s former coach at Manchester United, Ralf Rangnick, has responded to the Portugal national team captain’s demeaning comment during an interview with Piers Morgan. Recall that Rangnick was at Old Trafford for most of the 2021-2022 season following his appointment last November as an interim coach. The 64-year-old German took over from Ole Gunnar Solskjaer and was due at Old Trafford for a further two years in a consultancy role but eventually signed out of the club on mutual ground.

item.title: Why Tinubu, Amaechi, Okorocha, Others Contesting Against Osinbajo Are Shivering
item.description: The Oba of Benin, Oba Ewuare II, has said those contesting for the presidential ticket of the All Progressives Congress (APC) against Vice President Yemi Osinbajo are shivering over his credentials. Naija News reports that the traditional ruler of Benin Kingdom made this known on Thursday when VP Osinbajo paid him a visit at his palace ad part of ongoing consultations with stakeholders on his ambition to succeed President Muhammadu Buhari in 2023.

item.title: INEC Confirms 16 Political Parties To Take Part
item.description: The Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) has disclosed that 16 political parties have formally informed the Commission of their desire to partake in the upcoming Edo governorship election set for September 2024. Furthermore, the Commission has been informed by these political parties about their chosen methods and dates for conducting primaries. The INEC National Commissioner and Chairman of the Information and Voter Education Committee, Sam Olumekun, stated in a statement issued on Thursday that the Commission had previously released the timetable and agenda for the Edo State off-cycle gubernatorial election.

item.title: Why I Agreed To Be Peter Obi's Running Mate Baba-Ahmed
item.description: The founder of Baze University in Abuja, Datti Baba-Ahmed, has revealed the reason he agreed to be the running mate of the presidential candidate of the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi. Speaking on Trust TV’s Daily Politics on Monday, Baba-Ahmed said he agreed to be Obi’s running mate because of his integrity and principle on financial management. The LP vice presidential candidate added that he investigated the former Anambra State Governor over allegations that he is in support of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and its activities.

item.title: 20 best medieval movies and TV shows you can find on Netflix
item.description: Notable political, social, and religious changes took part in the Middle Ages. Medieval movies and television shows do an excellent job of explaining how those times were, albeit in a more entertaining manner. They help us to understand the history of the world in a more relatable way. Why is it called Medieval? Medieval comes from the Latin words medium aevum, which translate to middle age. Medieval movies and TV shows, therefore, revolve around this time that started in 476 AD and lasted for about 1000 years.

item.title: Gary Sheffield - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Nine-time MLB All-Star outfielder who won a World Series Championship in 1997 with the Florida Marlins. Before Fame He began his MLB career with the Milwaukee Brewers in 1988. Trivia In April of 2009, he hit his 500th homer as a member of the New York Mets against the Milwaukee Brewers; he retired with 509 career home runs. Family Life Had three sons with gospel singer DeLeon. Associated With His uncle Dwight Gooden was a star New York Mets pitcher who won the NL Cy Young Award in 1985.

item.title: Ohanaeze Slams Oluwo After He Claimed Igbos Can't Be Trusted With Nigeria's Presidency
item.description: The Igbo socio-political organization, Ohanaeze Ndigbo Worldwide has carpeted the Oluwo of Iwo, Oba Abdulrosheed Adewale Akanbi over his claims that Nigerians would not vote for an Igbo president in 2023. The group said as a traditional ruler, the Oluwo should be a father to all and not be the one stroking the fires of ethnicity in Nigeria through partisan politics. Ohanaeze in a statement by its National Publicity Secretary, Chief Alex Ogbonnia on Tuesday cautioned the monarch against sowing seeds of discord against the Igbo people in the race for the 2023 presidency and other general issues.

item.title: Two Killed As Police Clash With Terrorists In Katsina
item.description: Two persons were reportedly killed on Wednesday when a group of terrorists invaded Gidan Baushe, Gatakawa village communities of Kankara Local Government Area of Katsina State. The State Command of the Nigeria Police Force confirmed this in a statement on Thursday through its spokesperson, SP Gambo Isah. Naija News learnt that the assailants had earlier stormed the communities and abducted no fewer than 18 people. The terrorists according to reports stormed the communities at midnight riding on motorcycles and started shooting sporadically.

item.title: Lawmakers Impeach Ekiti Assembly Speaker Aribisogan, Elect Adelugba As Replacement
item.description: Members of the Ekiti State House of Assembly have impeached the Speaker, Gboyega Aribisogan, with immediate effect. Naija News reports that the lawmakers, thereafter, elected Olubunmi Adelugba, as the new speaker during a closed-door plenary session on Monday. Seventeen out of the 25 members impeached the lawmaker representing Ikole constituency in Ekiti as the speaker and suspended him indefinitely. The Assembly Complex had been sealed as members were embroiled in a leadership tussle following the death of the former speaker, Funminiyi Afuye.

item.description: New Zealander who became famous for her role as TV's Xena: Warrior Princess. She also played Lucretia in the series Sparacus: Blood and Sand, its sequel, and its prequel. In 2015, she began playing Countess Marburg on the WGN series Salem. She had a role in the Disney film Bedtime Stories. Before Fame She began acting in secondary school, performing in her first musical at age 10. Trivia Hercules was her love interest on the show Xena: Warrior Princess.

item.title: Obasanjo Turns Keke Rider, Picks Passengers In Ogun (Photo)
item.description: Former President of Nigeria, Olusegun Obasanjo on Saturday droved a tricycle (keke) as part of his 85th birthday celebration. The elder statesman rode through some roads in Abeokuta, the capital of Ogun, to pick up passengers. The former president caught the attention of residents of the community who cheered Obasanjo and took photos. Obasanjo who offered rides to citizens, moved through Moshood Abiola, NNPC Mega Station, and Kuto Market, among others.

item.title: Buhari's Minister Declares Interest In Becoming APC National Chairman, Rolls Out Manifesto
item.description: The incumbent Minister of Special Duties and Inter-Governmental Affairs, Senator George Akume has declared interest in emerging the next National Chairman of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC). Akume who has now released his manifesto through his campaign team, vowed to take the APC to the next level and unite every disgruntled persons or groups in the party. Speaking on behalf of the Minister, the George Akume Campaign Organisation (GACO) led by former National Publicity Secretary of the defunct National Party of Nigeria(NPN) Chief Simone Shango said Akume is the right candidate.

item.title: High Inflation Raises Social Risk In Nigeria
item.description: On Friday, Moody’s, a worldwide rating agency, revealed on its website that the nation’s rising inflation is putting strain on government spending and increasing the likelihood of societal unrest. Naija News reports that the agency revised its assessment of Nigeria, citing potential improvement in the nation’s external and fiscal positions as a result of recent reform initiatives, from stable to positive. However, it said that Nigeria’s weak external and fiscal positions are reflected in the confirmation of its Caa1 grade.

item.title: Nikola Tesla - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, and physicist who invented the electrical motor, arc lighting, and AC power. He did high-voltage, high-frequency power experiments in New York which later led to the invention of radio communication. Before Fame He was so proficient at doing calculus in his head that his teachers thought he was cheating. Trivia Though his work made him a lot of money, he spent most of it on the experiments themselves and lived much of his life in a series of hotels.

item.title: Synagogue Mute Over Zuma's Claims
item.description: The Synagogue Church of All Nations (SCOAN) has remained silent over claims by South African President, Jacob Zuma, who said that 67 of his nationals died in the disaster that happened in the church on Friday. The church has said nothing on the number of people affected neither have they said anything about their identities. Rather than react to Zuma’s claims, the church on Wednesday, September 17, went round the various hospitals where survivors are being treated in search of South Africans.

item.description: - Wanaume wawili walikatwakatwa kwa mapanga na kufariki papo hapo baada ya kupatikana wakiwa wameiba kuku wa jirani wao kijijini Ugweri kaunti ya Embu - Baada ya kuuawa na wakazi wenye hamaki, miili ya wawili hao iliripotiwa kuchomwa kwa kumwagiwa petroli Wanaume wawili kutoka kijiji cha Ugweri kaunti ya Embu waliuawa na wakazi wenye hamaki kwa kukatwakatwa kwa mapanga baada ya kupatikana wakiwa wameiba kuku wa jirani Afisa mkuu wa kituo cha polisi cha Ugweri Peter Muchemi alisema kuwa mfugaji kuku hizo alisikia kelele kutoka nyumba wanamolala kuku wake na alipoenda kuangalia kilichokuwa kikiendelea, aligundua kuwa kuku wawili walikuwa wameibwa.

item.description: Magazeti ya Jumanne, Septemba 28, yameipa uzito mkutano wa kinara wa Orange Democratic Movement (ODM), Raila Odinga na Rais Uhuru Kenyatta kubuni mikakati ya kampeni zake za 2022. Magazeti haya pia yameguzia uamuzi wa Mahakama Kuu kuzuia kwa muda Mamlaka ya Ukusanyaji Ushuru Nchini (KRA) kuongeza ushuru wa mafuta 1. The Star The Star linaripoti kuwa washauri wa karibu wa Uhuru na wafadhili wa kampeni zake za 2017 wanabuni mkakati wa kampeni za urais za Raila.

item.title: NPower Issues Fresh Warning To Applicants
item.description: The administrators of the federal government social intervention scheme, NPower, has again warned Nigerians against the kinds of details they give out to cyber-cafe operators. The administrators who have been releasing guidelines and instructions that should be adhered to by prospective beneficiaries again cautioned that confidential details should not be given to cafe operators. It also advised applicants to ensure that details entered in the portal are their correct details and not personal details of the cyber-cafe operators, adding that every information must be cross-checked before submission to avoid the chances of missing out on the scheme.

item.title: Waven First Impressions: In-Depth and Colorful Deckbuilder
item.description: 'Waven' Has Impressive Deckbuilding Depth and Colorful Tactics Battles — First ImpressionsBy Anthony JonesPublished June 16 2023, 12:00 p.m. ET Source: AnkamaDuring a hands-off preview event last month, French developer Ankama revealed Waven as an MMORPG deckbuilder promising depth, giddy fun, and colorful battles. The team already has a solid reputation for making fun tactical games, as seen with the highly-acclaimed Dofus and Wakfu. Reshaping the feel of its staple grid-based combat and cartoony art style, Anakama has again molded a compelling strategy title with Waven.

item.title: 30 Valentine's Day Cards That Are Anything But Romantic
item.description: These Valentine's Day cards are a lot of things, but romantic is not one of them. Source: pinterestIf you're really in love with someone then every single day should be Valentine's Day. You should be over the moon with the person you're with and do everything you can to pull romantic gestures out of nowhere to make them happy. item.title: Akpabio Speaks On Joining 2023 Presidential Race
item.description: The Minister of Niger Delta Affairs, Godswill Akpabio has distanced himself from the 2023 presidential race ahead of the general elections. item.title: Sultan Asks Muslims To Watch Out For Moon, Reveals When Fast Will Start
item.description: The Sultan of Sokoto, Alhaji Muhammad Sa’ad Abubakar III has urged Muslims to be on the lookout for the moon signalling the commencement of the 2022 Ramadan fast. The Sultan issued the advice in a statement in Abuja on Thursday by the Nigerian Supreme Council for Islamic Affairs (NSCIA) through the Director of Administration of the council, Zubairu Haruna Usman-Ugwu. The NSCIA under the leadership of the Sultan as its President-General told Muslims in the country to watch out for the Ramadan moon after sunset on Friday, 1st April.

item.title: Nigerian Soldiers Move Against Newspaper Distribution Across The Country
item.description: More than 15 years since Nigeria returned to Democratic rule in 1999, it appears the country is returning to the dark days of military dictatorship. item.description: Tieflings are known for their somewhat ambiguous nature of being half-human and half-extraplanar. They have spectacular intelligence and strength. If you want to use Tieflings in your fantasy games, you will need to find the right Tiefling names that fit your character. Have a look at some unique options to help you come up with the best one. Tieflings are believed to be from a generation of the devil and bad omen.

item.title: Marwan Kenzari - Edad, Familia, Biografa
item.description: Acerca De Actor holandés-tunecino que hizo la transición a Hollywood en el 2016 al conseguir papeles en Collide, Ben-Hur y The Promise. Su reconocimiento en Hollywood continuó en el 2017 con papeles destacados en The Mummy y Murder on the Orient Express. Más tarde fue elegido para la nueva versión de acción en vivo de Aladdin como Jafar y para la película The Angel de Netflix. Antes de la Fama Su carrera como actor comenzó cuando era adolescente, después de que una chica con quien salía lo inscribiera para una audición de una versión holandesa del musical Chicago.

item.title: Medical Experts Predict COVID-19 Fifth Wave Will Peak in November, Warn 3k People May Die
item.description: Shem Sam Otoi, the COVID-19 programmes coordinator for the Lake Region Economic Block, said 75,000 infections would be recorded during the periodThe medical expert said 50,000 infections would be mildHe asked Kenyans to get vaccinated to avert the situationMedical experts have warned that over 3,000 people may die in November when the COVID-19 fifth wave is expected to peak. According to the projections, over 1,000 people would lose their lives to the virus if the peak is mild.

item.title: US election: Supreme Court rejects Republican demand to overturn Biden's Pennsylvania victory
item.description: - Days after the US elections, Joe Biden's victory in Pennsylvania has again been upheld by the Supreme Court - A Republican congressman, Mike Kelly, had filed a suit to the apex court - The suit challenged the mail-in votes used during the presidential election PAY ATTENTION: Click “See First” under the “Following” tab to see Legit.ng News on your Facebook News Feed! The United States Supreme Court on Tuesday, December 8, voided a suit filed by a Republican congressman, Mike Kelly, to cancel Joe Biden's victory in Pennsylvania during the presidential election.

item.title: Why Mumias Sugar Has Been Shut down
item.description: Operations at Mumias Sugar Company, one of the largest sugar millers in East and Central Africa have been suspended for one month to allow for maintenance of equipment. Coutts Otolo, the managing director at Mumias Sugar Company said the closure will allow the firm to fix faulty machines. It is reported that the faulty equipment has contributed to poor performance due to frequent breakdowns. READ ALSO: Mumias Farmers Travel To Nairobi For Kidero Vs.
